storyInfo: After the funeral, the Exiled King once again appears before Loughshinny, inviting her to witness the secret within the palace ruins for herself. Loughshinny comes face to face with Tara's past, and the story of the Exiled King himself.

attributes.content: So you won't go to the city, even to perform a fire-returning ceremony?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: What you've described is highly unusual. We cannot simply take your word that the residents are no longer among the living.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: Besides, the fire-returning ceremony is just that—a ceremony. Do not expect it to be anything more than that.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: ...Very well, then. You may return, wakewoman. Thank you for your help.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: You intend to go back to Na Saoirsí, even without us?
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: Moran and the others have settled in well, and I've done what Nemos entrusted to me, so...
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: My work here is done.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Take care, Your Highness.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: I will.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: The red dragon sets out in the direction from whence she came. Everything that happened yesterday seems but a distant shadow now.
But also a tiny spark of flame.
'Return the fire'...
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Have you made up your mind to go to your death?
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: The stranger?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Good timing, sir. May we talk? If you will help me—
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Did your red dragon history lessons ever teach you about a poor wretch by the name of Labhréathach?
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Excuse me?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: I'll take that as a 'no'.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: After returning to the palace for the first time in years, he never even had the chance to see his brother before the guards took him away and plunged a sword through his chest.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: I know the story.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Then why are you so eager to follow in his footsteps, and have history remember you as a fool?
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Leave. You've seen your sister, and you're still alive. In that, you've already achieved more than he ever did.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: The story of Labhréathach and Ailill is not the story of me and Eblana.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: ...Fine. Let's say I was willing to hear you out. What did you want to talk about?
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: The city's fire-returning ceremony.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: I just wanted to find someone to help with the preparations, but you seem to know a lot about the history and tales of Tara. So I was thinking you might be able to help.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: History? Tales?
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: We can talk on the way. Come.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: But that's not the way to the Dark Woods—
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Just follow me. It worked out for you in the woods, didn't it?
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: ...The ruins of the palace?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: I've been here before. It's dangerous. The Originium-rich environment is—
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: You said you wanted history and tales. What better place in Tara than this *ancient Tengae expletive* palace?
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: The what palace?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Ah, never mind.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: I appreciate your help in the woods, but I have important business to attend to. I don't have time to—
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: And what's this 'important business'? Dying for nothing?
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Sure, you're different from your sister. That dragon's flames may be cursed, but her personality is as typical as they come. Arrogant, leaving no room for any other voice. You may be better, but—
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: I'm different from my sister, but she's not who you say she is.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: But however different you may be, conflict is in the nature of the red dragons. Even if you were merely dragged into it.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: And there is only ever one outcome. Only one may emerge alive.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: One of you will die, sooner or later. So what's the hurry?
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Have patience, young dragon. We're almost there.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: We come here for this altar.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Altar? You mean that thing in the middle? Isn't that... the furnace?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: 'The furnace which fused together the weapons of every Taran soldier, and overturned the fate of the dynasty'... The furnace from which fallen soldiers were reborn.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: That's what you call it today, isn't it? Far more important than just another 'altar', to be sure.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: But an altar is an altar, even if it's a little bigger than the others. It was based on the ceremonial stone circle used to coronate the King Gaeil, and the palace was built around it.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Whenever an old red dragon died, this is where the fire was returned to them.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: The fire... returned?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: What you saw back at those wood-brains' camp. Gotta give them credit: they managed to remember all that, even centuries later.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Fire-returning wasn't just about a bonfire back in the day, though.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: By the time of the old hag Máighréad, it was enough for the siblings of the heir to the title of King Gaeil to put their hands into the fire and get a few blisters.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Go back even further, though, and those siblings would have been burned alive together. Or so they say. There's no hard evidence.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Now you've gone even paler.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: He flicks his hand, and a speck of purple fire flies forth from his sleeve, joining the same purple fire in the altar.
The flames breathe quietly, like an infant in its mother's embrace.
Your flame is purple too?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: No, wait, you're a Draco...? Could you be—
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Awfully slow, aren't you? Well, it's too late to run. Put your hand in.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: What?!
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: You want Na Saoirsí to return its fire, didn't you? Put your hand in.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: The red dragon falls silent, then stretches out her hand to touch the flame in the furnace. As expected, it is not warm, but to her surprise it does not feel cold either.
Now, I brought you here to see something—
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: The tragedy of Tara, the ill-repute of the red dragons... It is simply the cruel cycle of fate repeating itself, again and again.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Like your sister, I was an aberration that breathed the flames of death. It is not my intention to disrespect the dead, nor could I even if I wanted to, but I wanted to show you...
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: The fate of those who die upon this land.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.text: Is this where we should begin? Understandable. Of all recent events, it is the most significant.
Your sister was right. Those who have touched the flames of death are beyond help. Yet the fire should not have spread so readily.
What hatred did it take for the Dracos to once again sire an ill-omened aberration, the first in six hundred years?
Ah, and him.
If you ask me, he slept in far too late. Could hardly drag himself out of bed by sunset. Of course he became the sacrifice.

attributes.content: ...Even you should not speak of the dead so lightly. Do not justify it as a sacrifice.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.text: You can only say that because you've seen too little. Those feelings will pass soon enough, once you're used to it—
See, here comes another sacrifice.

attributes.content: The Victorians who killed you have been chased out!
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: The last Victorian bastard died... before my eyes...
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.text: In a sense, your sister's dream did become reality. The Tarans have risen, and the Victorians have fallen. Simple. Direct. 'Satisfying'.

attributes.content: Were you... one of the bystanders too?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.text: Don't get caught up on that, child. You know what I am.
This, I don't recognize. Explain.

attributes.content: ...It was a war.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.text: There are always wars. Be specific. Who did she incinerate, and what land did she set her sights on?

attributes.content: Victoria. Eblana wanted to take Tara back from the Aslans. This was the conclusion to that war.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.text: The Aslans? Those conceited bastards? But is she not facing a Sarkaz?
Never mind. The lions were the ones who stole Victoria. That's all I need to know.
I don't need you to tell me what this is, just as I can tell the expression beneath the mask.
The satisfaction and joy that only appear on a red dragon's visage in the face of certain death.

attributes.content: No... that wasn't joy. It was the opposite—
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.text: The opposite? Maybe you were simply gravely injured and started hallucinating on the brink of death.
But as I said, this's simply repeating the past. Cities may ride on wheels now, and the master of the realm has changed hands, but what's inside never changes.
What is this? Your home? Where did you learn to point your blades at each other? Who's this man?

attributes.content: The Earl of Warwick. Our foster father.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Eblana said he helped Tarans see hope, a hope they could see but never reach. That all he ever did was drive thirsty travelers mad with mirages.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: In his hand he held a delicate thread. On one end were the Tarans who had rediscovered their name, on the other lay the oppressors who had trodden upon them for so long.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: ...That thread was my sister and I.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Looking back... perhaps he was the first to be afflicted by the purple flame.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: ...Hah.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Not only do you sympathize with your sister, but you also know her well. No wonder you're so loath to kill her.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: But I have no intention of becoming like her, nor will I simply allow myself to be killed.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: These events, this history you had me recall. What are you trying to tell me?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: That the history of Tara is nothing but the continuous accumulation and recombination of ruins of the past. What you have seen, I have too. Nothing new can be found within.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: What I see are not ruins, but... the source of the flames.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: The flames in Na Saoirsí are indeed my sister's fire, but they are also the great sorrow behind the bloodshed, left with nowhere to go.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: It was the war... no, the pain, the oppression, the things taken from them, which began long before the war. That's what lit the fire in their hearts.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: My sister shaped their sorrow into hatred, which scorched the fields of Tara and drove out the Victorians.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: However, without vengeance to cloak the sorrow, that same fire has come back to burn them, burning away everything they have, until they are nothing but the walking dead.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: A fine summary, child. But do you really think that returning the fire would solve all the city's problems?
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: It's the only path before me.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: True. But how do you tread it?
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Come. We've seen your story. Now see mine.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: (Ancient Tengae) Don't cry now. It's just a cloudbeast.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: (Ancient Tengae) But I raised Greyclaw from when she was a baby...
attributes.name: Sad Girl

attributes.content: (Ancient Tengae) They say your fire is different, Daidí. You do not heal the living, but instead bring the dead back to life...
attributes.name: Sad Girl

attributes.content: (Ancient Tengae) They don't come back. It's just an empty shell.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: (Ancient Tengae) Even if it's just an empty shell... Please, Daidí, I just want to hear Greyclaw's voice again...
attributes.name: Sad Girl

attributes.text: And so the impulsive red dragon let his daughter's plea get the better of his judgment.
After a few months, strange things began to happen, not just to the cloudbeast, but to all the beasts of the pasture.
Burdenbeasts no longer ate grass. Cystybeasts no longer gave milk. The old refused to die, the young refused to live, and bare skeletons devoid of flesh began to roam the pastures.
As the purple fire spread through the herds, the red dragon was forced to leave the pasture with his people. He made the same mistake many times throughout his brief existence.

attributes.content: The purple fire spread through the herds?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.text: What about it? Your own dear sister dared to burn people with that same fire. Now THAT'S crazy.

attributes.content: How was the fire extinguished?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.text: You'll find out soon enough.

attributes.content: This is... the citadel in Na Saoirsí? That same corridor?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.text: No. But your mistake is understandable.
We simply took a large step back in time. This is how the palace you currently stand in looked six hundred years ago.
It's incredible how stonemasons centuries hence managed to perfectly recreate it in this 'Na Saoirsí' of yours.

attributes.content: So what happened here?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.text: Here... hah...

attributes.content: Labhréathach the fool had made too many mistakes, the likes of which you have already seen. He grew weak, and felt his end coming.
On the eve of Samhain, he came to see the brother he had not seen for twenty years, bearing the finest gifts his nomadic life would allow.
He even convinced the druids of the city, who oversaw the festival's ceremonies, to take him to his brother.
Touched by his familial love, they led him into the city. But he failed to realize when his guide's silhouette, voice, and demeanor changed, not until it was too late.
He was taken to this very corridor, and—

I doubt that Ailill, who gave the order to assassinate his brother, was on that balcony on the other side of the door. For my eyes were wide open until the very end, but I never saw his fire through the gaps.
Where did it all go wrong?
Was he angry that the priests continued to treat me as royalty? Did he consider me leaving without a word twenty years earlier a betrayal?
Or was it someone else who wanted me dead, and he simply had no choice?
I'll never know.
Within this brief, swift act of violence, there was only one thing that I had long known, that I had never doubted—
A red dragon never forgives. The hatred of the dragons is even longer than the history of Tara.
But there is more I want to tell you.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: After I died, Ailill ordered my coffin dragged through the city, for all to see the end that befell me.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: And so purple fire raged through every pasture I had stayed at with my clan. Life turned its back on all who touched it; only death remained.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Seven days later, the priests returned my fire to me at a clearing outside the Dark Woods. And only when the fire they returned to me was extinguished did the purple flames in the pastures begin to subside.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: It was only then that the last vestige of my consciousness that remained in the flames after death faded into darkness.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: All living things that touched the flames, people or beasts, were turned to ash.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Your sister spoke true. The flames will continue to spread as long as she lives.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: But she is a typical red dragon. She is not so noble as to give up her life to save those who have yet to survive. If she is inviting you back, then it is certainly a trap.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Run. Call for help. Yell. Find someone who is her equal to extinguish the endlessly spreading flames. That is the only way.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: But what if she has already decided that I'm the only one worthy to dance with her?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: What if I can't abandon the lives in the city to their fates, as long as there is any chance of saving them?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: So you'll return the fire to someone who's still alive?
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: And what if that doesn't work?
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Regardless, I'm going back, no matter what.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Silence, and then Loughshinny hears a sigh.
(Ancient Tengae) I suppose stubbornness and stupidity really are hereditary.
attributes.name: The Exiled King
